questions.question: There are some problems, ...............................?
questions.description: Negative tags are used after affirmative sentences and non-negative tags are used after negative sentences.

questions.question: Not a great film, .............................?
questions.description: Negative tags are used after affirmative sentences and non-negative tags are used after negative sentences.

questions.question: You do take sugar in tea, ...............................?
questions.description: In question tags we repeat the auxiliary verb used in the main sentence. Negative tags are used after affirmative sentences and non-negative tags are used after negative sentences.

questions.question: They don't have meetings on Sundays, ...............................?
questions.description: Negative tags are used after affirmative sentences and non-negative tags are used after negative sentences.

questions.question: They won the first prize, ...............................?
questions.description: If the main sentence has no auxiliary, the question tag uses do, does or did. Do and does are used in the present tense. Did is used in the past tense.

questions.question: They promised to repay the money within two months, ...............................?
She wants to be an architect, .......................................?
questions.description: When the main sentence is in the simple present tense, we use do or does in the question tag. Do is used with plural nouns and pronouns. Does is used with singular nouns and pronouns.

questions.question: You like fish, ...................................?
questions.description: We use do with plural nouns and the pronouns I, we and you. We use does with singular nouns and the pronouns she, he and it.

questions.question: The meeting started at 6, ..................................?
questions.description: Only pronouns are used in tags.
